title: Kamadeva
summary: Kama (Sanskrit: काम, IAST: Kāma), also known as Kamadeva and Madana, is the Hindu god of human [2] desire, often portrayed along with his female counterpart Rati. According to Garuda Purana, Pradyumna and Samba — the sons of Krishna, Sanat Kumara — the son of Brahma, Skanda — the son of Shiva, Sudarshana (the preciding deity of Sudarshana Chakra), and Bharata are all incarnations of Kama.[3][2]
